item.title: 波兰Azoty公司寻求在聚合物业务重组中减记83%债务
item.description: 格鲁帕阿佐蒂公司正寻求偿还约17%的债务，这些债务用于建造中东欧地区最大的丙烯和聚丙烯生产基地。【原文：Grupa Azoty SA seeks to settle just about 17% of debt taken to build the biggest propylene and polypropylene complex in central and eastern Europe.】

item.title: 马来西亚伊斯兰党在反对党联盟重组中崛起
item.description: 马来西亚伊斯兰党在历经数月内部分裂后，正逐步掌控反对党联盟。此举可能增强该党影响力，并在2028年前举行的全国大选前重塑政治格局。【原文：Malaysia’s Islamist party is taking control of the opposition coalition following months of internal rift, a move that could increase its influence and disrupt the political landscape ahead of a general election due by 2028.】

item.title: 德国反对欧盟债务立场未变，克林贝尔向《法兰克福汇报》表示
item.description: 德国财政部长拉尔斯·克林贝尔表示，德国认为没有必要改变其对欧洲共同债务的立场，支持总理弗里德里希·梅尔茨反对近期呼吁增加联合借贷的呼声。【原文：German Finance Minister Lars Klingbeil said Germany sees no need to revise its stance on common European debt, backing Chancellor Friedrich Merz in opposing recent calls for more joint borrowing.】

item.title: 马克龙要求特朗普解除对欧洲官员的制裁
item.description: 法国总统埃马纽埃尔·马克龙致函唐纳德·特朗普，要求这位美国同行解除对包括前欧盟委员蒂埃里·布雷顿在内的官员实施的制裁。【原文：French President Emmanuel Macron wrote to Donald Trump asking his US counterpart to lift sanctions imposed on officials including former European Union Commissioner Thierry Breton.】

item.title: 马来西亚反贪污委员会主席因持股调查遭问询
item.description: 马来西亚反贪污委员会主席阿赞·巴基周四被特别调查委员会传唤，就其持股问题作出说明。此前，当局已响应要求对其展开调查的呼声。【原文：Malaysia’s anti-graft chief Azam Baki was summoned by a special committee set up to probe his stock ownership to explain the matter on Thursday, as authorities respond to calls for him to be investigated.】

item.title: 阿联酋称挫败针对关键部门的网络攻击浪潮
item.description: 阿拉伯联合酋长国表示已挫败一系列人工智能支持的网络攻击，并警告称未具名的恐怖组织所采用的手段正发生"质的飞跃"。【原文：The United Arab Emirates said it thwarted a series of AI-backed cyberattacks and warned of a “qualitative shift” in the methods used by terrorist groups it didn’t identify.】

item.title: 特朗普峰会前夕，美国关税政策逆转使习近平占据上风
item.description: 中国国家主席习近平正带着增强的谈判筹码走向与特朗普的谈判桌，此前美国总统已丧失了几乎可以随意提高关税的能力。【原文：Chinese President Xi Jinping is heading to the negotiating table with Donald Trump with a boost in bargaining power, after the US leader lost his ability to quickly raise tariffs for nearly any reason.】

item.title: 印度推迟赴美行程 以敲定关税裁决相关贸易协定
item.description: 印度贸易官员将推迟赴美行程，该行程原定旨在敲定两国的临时协议。此前美国最高法院作出裁决，推翻了特朗普总统实施的多项关税措施。【原文：Indian trade officials will postpone a trip to the US aimed at finalizing their interim deal after a US Supreme Court ruling that struck down many of President Donald Trump’s tariffs.】

item.title: 日本执政党税务负责人称美国关税状况"混乱"
item.description: 日本执政党自民党重量级人物称美国关税政策"一团糟"，此前美国总统特朗普因最高法院裁定其先前关税政策违法而提高关税。【原文：A heavyweight of Japan’s ruling Liberal Democratic Party called US tariffs “a real mess” after President Donald Trump hiked levies in response to a Supreme Court decision that his previous tariffs were illegal.】

item.title: 澳大利亚称正权衡所有选项应对"不合理"关税
item.description: 澳大利亚政府表示，在特朗普总统对外国进口商品征收15%关税后，将"审视所有选项"。【原文：Australia’s government said it will “examine all options” after US President Donald Trump imposed a 15% tariff on foreign imports.】

item.title: 中国无惧全球"人工智能恐慌交易"，投资者追逐赢家
item.description: 美国市场正陷入"人工智能恐慌交易"的漩涡，投资者纷纷抛售软件公司和财富管理机构的股票，担忧人工智能的迅猛发展将侵蚀传统商业模式。【原文：US markets are gripped by the “AI scare trade,” with investors selling software firms and wealth managers on concern that rapid advances in artificial intelligence will erode established business models.】

item.title: 司法部调查Netflix在华纳交易审查中对电影制作人的影响力
item.description: 美国司法部对奈飞公司拟以720亿美元收购华纳兄弟探索公司的调查，包括审查这家流媒体巨头的行为，以及其在节目收购谈判中是否对内容创作者施加了反竞争性影响。【原文：The Justice Department’s investigation of Netflix Inc.’s proposed $72 billion takeover of Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. includes scrutiny of the streaming giant’s behavior and whether it wields anticompetitive leverage over creators in negotiations for acquiring programming.】

item.title: 德国即将检验其复苏是否真实
item.description: 未来数日德国将公布的数据，将揭示这个欧洲最大经济体究竟是即将迎来实质性复苏，还是仍受困于特朗普的关税政策及其自身长期存在的缺陷。【原文：Data from Germany in the coming days will shed light on whether Europe’s largest economy is on the cusp of a meaningful revival or still being hampered by Donald Trump’s tariffs and its own chronic shortcomings.】

item.title: 霍尼韦尔考虑退出与庄信万丰的催化剂交易
item.description: 知情人士透露，霍尼韦尔国际公司正考虑放弃收购庄信万丰公司的催化剂技术业务。【原文：Honeywell International Inc. is considering walking away from its acquisition of Johnson Matthey Plc’s Catalyst Technologies business, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 风险最高的CLO基金亮起警示灯：《信贷周刊》
item.description: 随着投资者对承担信贷风险变得更加谨慎，对违约率上升的担忧正从杠杆贷款市场蔓延至最终购买这些债务的某些零售基金。【原文：Fear of rising defaults is spreading from the leveraged loan market to some of the retail funds that ultimately buy the debt as investors get choosier about taking on credit risk.】

item.title: 美国宇航局推迟登月任务以修复火箭，排除三月发射计划
item.description: 美国国家航空航天局正准备将其巨大的月球火箭移离发射台进行技术故障修复，这将推迟该机构备受期待的四名宇航员绕月飞行任务。【原文：NASA is preparing to remove its massive moon rocket from its launchpad to fix a technical issue, delaying the agency’s much-anticipated mission to send a crew of four around the moon.】

item.title: 特朗普称将把全球关税从10%提高至15%
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普表示，他将把前日宣布的全球10%关税提高至15%，同时猛烈抨击美国最高法院裁定其关税征收机制违法的判决。【原文：President Donald Trump said he will increase the global 10% tariff he announced one day ago to 15% as he lashed out at the US Supreme Court over its ruling that his mechanism for applying tariffs was illegal.】

item.title: 默茨领导的基民盟呼吁对社交媒体平台实施年龄限制
item.description: 德国总理候选人弗里德里希·默茨所属的保守派政党基督教民主联盟呼吁禁止未成年人在德国使用Instagram和TikTok等社交媒体平台。此举可能在默茨下月与美国总统特朗普会晤前，加剧与美国数字服务行业的紧张关系。【原文：Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s conservative Christian Democratic Union party called for a ban on the use of social media networks such as Instagram and Tiktok for minors in Germany, a move that risks straining relations with the US digital services industry ahead of a meeting with President Donald Trump next month.】

item.title: 比特币万亿美元身份危机四面楚歌
item.description: 一年前这似乎还难以想象。但比特币如今深陷前所未有的困境，且未见明显出路。【原文：It wouldn’t have seemed possible a year ago. But Bitcoin has gotten caught in one of its deepest struggles yet, with no obvious way out.】

item.title: 特朗普关税政策调整后各国政府的反应如下
item.description: 以下是美国最高法院宣布特朗普总统广泛的紧急关税无效，并驳回其依据另一项法律条款征收10%全球关税的后续举措后，各国政府的反应。【原文：Here’s what governments around the world are saying after the US Supreme Court invalidated President Donald Trump’s broad emergency tariffs and his subsequent move to impose a 10% global tariff under a different statute.】

item.title: 柯克兰明星律师的反垄断警告为其离职埋下伏笔
item.description: 在柯克兰律师事务所的十五年职业生涯中，大卫·内梅切克主要通过利用宽松的贷款协议来完善一种在困境企业债务领域屡见不鲜的操作模式：设计出令部分债权人无法拒绝的债务重组方案，同时让其他债权人只得残羹冷炙，从而为公司的私募股权所有者争取宝贵时间以规避损失。【原文：For the better part of 15 years at law firm Kirkland & Ellis, David Nemecek made a career out of exploiting loose lending agreements to perfect what would become a well-worn dance in the world of distressed corporate debt: Craft a debt overhaul too good for one set of a company’s creditors to pass up while leaving other creditors with scraps and buying precious time for the company’s private equity owners to avoid losses.】

item.title: 投资者青睐塞内加尔短期债券，债务担忧持续存在
item.description: 投资者在周五的拍卖中更青睐塞内加尔短期债券，因市场对其长期债务可持续性的担忧持续存在。【原文：Investors preferred short-term Senegal bonds at an auction Friday as concerns over its long-term debt sustainability linger.】

item.title: 美国股市看似疲软，实则暗藏破纪录波动性
item.description: 股市表面看似平静，实则已停滞数月，暗流涌动之下剧烈波动，股价的剧烈震荡令交易员们疲于应对，更预示着未来可能出现更多动荡。【原文：The placid surface of an equity market that’s treaded water for months is masking dramatic swings underneath, as stock moves whipsaw traders and threaten more turbulence ahead.】

item.title: 伊朗学生通讯社称美国接受伊朗维持铀浓缩计划的提议
item.description: 伊朗半官方的伊朗学生通讯社援引该国一名外交官的话称，美国官员已接受伊朗继续铀浓缩活动的红线。【原文：US officials have accepted Iran’s red line of continuing to enrich uranium, the semi-official Iranian Students’ News Agency quoted one of the country’s diplomats as saying.】

item.title: 阿波罗公司的马克·罗温表示日本正蓄势待发迎来重大复苏
item.description: 这家另类资产管理公司邀请其合作伙伴前往东京，亲眼见证这些变化。【原文：The alternative asset manager brought its partners to Tokyo to see the changes firsthand.】

item.title: 拉加德对《华尔街日报》表示，卢特尼克在达沃斯的演讲"实在太过分了"
item.description: 欧洲央行行长克里斯蒂娜·拉加德表示，她中途退出了美国商务部长霍华德·卢特尼克在世界经济论坛上的演讲，因为她认为在该场合发表反欧洲言论不恰当。【原文：European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said she walked out of a speech by US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick at the World Economic Forum because she found his anti-European rhetoric inappropriate given the setting.】

item.title: 油商争相对冲伊朗风险，因年初油市剧烈波动
item.description: 原油市场正经历2022年以来最强劲的年度开局，供应冲击与制裁措施颠覆了市场对供应过剩的预期。如今交易员们正争相规避风险，以应对美国可能再次轰炸伊朗的前景。【原文：The oil market is in the middle of its strongest start to a year since 2022 as supply shocks and sanctions confound expectations of a glut. Now traders are racing to cover themselves against the prospect of the US bombing Iran again.】

item.title: 印度拥有独特的"人工智能主权"方案
item.description: 尽管任何国家都无法在短期内完全脱离美国或中国的模式，但替代方案正在涌现。【原文：While no country can fully decouple from US or Chinese models anytime soon, alternatives are emerging.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长帕内塔表示关税对美国的伤害大于对其他国家
item.description: 欧洲央行理事会成员法比奥·帕内塔表示，美国经济承担了特朗普总统征收关税的大部分负担。【原文：The US economy has borne most of the burden of tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump, according to European Central Bank Governing Council member Fabio Panetta.】

item.title: 世界各国领导人密切关注美国下一步动向，特朗普关税政策遭遇挫败
item.description: 美国最高法院宣布特朗普总统广泛的紧急关税措施无效后，全球各国政府纷纷谨慎应对，部分国家重申现有协议，另一些则采取观望态度以评估其下一步行动。【原文：Governments around the world reacted with caution after the US Supreme Court invalidated President Donald Trump’s broad emergency tariffs, with some reaffirming existing agreements and others taking a wait-and-see approach to evaluate his next steps.】
